title: Did Germans who voted for the Nazis in the 1920s and 1930s regret it after World War II? - Quora

response.answer_text: Did Germans who voted for the Nazis in the 1920s and 1930s regret it after World War II? Some Germans who voted for the Nazis in elections that culminated in a Nazi plurality in the Reichstag and thus Hitler’s appointment as Chancellor never regretted their votes, because they died in the war, whether in the military or in the bombings of German cities. Others clearly were later regretful, given the vast destruction brought upon their country by the war Hitler instigated. Some, from what has come to light, never did, and there are neo-Nazis who still support Hitler’s ideas in Germany today—a small number, but given the lessons of history a more astonishing phenomenon, if one thinks about it, than the existence of such hateful ideology in small numbers of Americans.

I am sure quite a few million regretted it sooner than the end of the war . Adolph Hitler's last election resulted in the Nazi Party only won 42% of the vote . That means he was opposed by 58% of the electorate in the last free election in Germany .
